thread.title: Grace Kelly's childhood home to open to public by 2018, prince says
thread.title_full: Grace Kelly's childhood home to open to public by 2018, prince says

author: Realtime Desk
title: Grace Kelly's childhood home to open to public by 2018, prince says
text:
Grace Kelly's childhood home to open to public by 2018, prince says Updated: January 31, 2017 — 8:26 AM EST 591 Share Arrow icon 
Grace Kelly's childhood home in Philadelphia will be open to the public by next year, her son says. 
Prince Albert of Monaco tells People Magazine the house at 3901 Henry Ave. in East Falls will primarily serve as an office for the Grace Kelly Foundation-USA and as a possible extension of the Princess Grace Irish Library. 
The prince told People that while, "there will be different public events, it won’t be exclusively a museum," citing community concerns and the need to maintain the neighborhood's residential quality. 
"While it is a historical landmark, I don’t think that a dedicated museum is the right avenue to take," he said. "There will though be any number of events which will facilitate public viewing.' ” 
Albert bought the brick Georgian style home in October . It was built by his grandfather in 1929, the year Grace Kelly was born. 
Asked for when it will open to the public, Albert told People: “To give ourselves enough room, I’m saying a year but it could be less than that. To give you an answer, 2018, possibly earlier.” 
People also reports that the Monaco-based Princess Grace Irish Library is in discussions with Villanova University on establish the library's first overseas extension at the house.
